citeinfo.title: Marine Casualty and Pollution Database by the U.S. Coast Guard

abstract.p: Provides details about marine casualty and pollution incidents investigated by the U.S. Coast Guard Marine Safety Officer. Nationwide database containing information on marine pollution incidents, vessels casualties, vessel information and other matters containing information on these areas for incidents which occur on the Bering Sea and other parts of Alaska. The database is an invaluable source of information in understanding particulars and circumstances of marine accidents and pollution incidents.
Source: Coast Guard Operations System Center - Martinsburg, West Virginia

descript.purpose: Coast Guard record keeping and information analysis on marine pollution incidents, vessels casualties, vessel information and other matters containing information on these areas for incidents which occur on the Bering Sea and other parts of Alaska.

idinfo.accconst: Federal Government maintained database which does contain Privacy Act Material
idinfo.useconst: Quality of information is uneven / information can be very difficult to extract and largely was to be done through Washington D.C.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metac: Federal Government maintained database which does contain Privacy Act Material
metainfo.metuc: Quality of information is uneven / information can be very difficult to extract and largely was to be done through Washington D.C.
